id-00013.name: Rob2e: Fantasy Grounds 5E Feats Effects Coding

id-00008.name: Knight of the Order of Vinoa

id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.
id-00001.name: Talons

id-00001.desc: The owl doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.
id-00001.name: Flyby

id-00002.desc: The owl has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.
id-00002.name: Keen Hearing and Sight

id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.
id-00001.name: Beak

id-00001.desc: The raven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.
id-00001.name: Mimicry

id-00001.label: Rage; ADVCHK: strength; ADVSAV: strength; DMG: 2 melee; RESIST: bludgeoning,slashing,piercing

id-00001.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
id-00001.name: Life Drain

id-00063.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
id-00063.damageresistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

id-00001.label: RESIST: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; RESIST: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, !magic; IMMUNE: necrotic, poison; IMMUNE: charmed, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

id-00063.languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak
id-00063.name: Specter 16

id-00001.desc: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
id-00001.name: Incorporeal Movement

id-00002.desc: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
id-00002.name: Sunlight Sensitivity

id-00001.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
id-00001.name: Life Drain

id-00064.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
id-00064.damageresistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

id-00001.label: RESIST: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; RESIST: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, !magic; IMMUNE: necrotic, poison; IMMUNE: charmed, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

id-00064.languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak
id-00064.name: Specter 9

id-00001.desc: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
id-00001.name: Incorporeal Movement

id-00002.desc: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
id-00002.name: Sunlight Sensitivity

id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.
id-00001.name: Bite

id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
id-00002.name: Claws

id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit. On Hit: 9 (2d8) cold-forged iron damage and 4 (1d6) fire damage
id-00001.name: Longsword of Vinoa
id-00001.value: Longsword of vinoa [M] [ATK: +3] [DMG: 2d8 cold-forged iron + 1d6 fire]

id-00001.desc: The Knight of the Order of Vinoa is trained in agility to the point that he can make a bonus move of 30 ft. once per round.
id-00001.name: Swift of Foot

id-00066.name: Knight of the Order of Vinoa

text.p: Knights of the Order of Vinoa beleive and serve the demi-human Vinoa. She gives each of them a magic totem that allows her to perceive what is going on around them. When they loose control of that item she recalls it to her presence.

id-00001.desc: A Knight of the Order of Vinoa may take one legendary action per round at the end of any character's turn.
id-00001.name: Legendary Actions

id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.
id-00001.name: Morningstar

id-00002.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage in melee or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage at range.
id-00002.name: Javelin

id-00001.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).
id-00001.name: Brute

id-00002.desc: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.
id-00002.name: Surprise Attack

id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.
id-00001.name: Morningstar

id-00002.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage in melee or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage at range.
id-00002.name: Javelin

id-00001.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).
id-00001.name: Brute

id-00002.desc: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.
id-00002.name: Surprise Attack

id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage + 5 (1d10) poison damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the toad can't bite another target.
id-00001.name: Bite

id-00002.desc: The toad makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the toad, and it takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of the toad's turns. The toad can have only one target swallowed at a time.\nIf the toad dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.
id-00002.name: Swallow

id-00001.desc: The toad can breathe air and water.
id-00001.name: Amphibious

id-00002.desc: The toad's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.
id-00002.name: Standing Leap

id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage if used with two hands.
id-00001.name: Longsword

id-00002.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.
id-00002.name: Longbow

id-00001.desc: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin that isn't incapacitated.
id-00001.name: Martial Advantage

text.p: Located next to the portal near the center of town.
Owned by: Dorrug Rockfist a Hill-Dwarf Life Cleric. Who is a part of the wierd beard clan, aka. benchsniffers.
Ceremony - (Coming Soon) Requiers a sourse of silver.
Healing Potions - (comming soon) Requiers an alchemist.
Protection potions (comming soon) Requiers an alchemist.
Rob2E's Store is located ___. It is self owned.
Raven Manor is located oposite the church. It is owned by Dabria.
text.h: Services of the Night Queen's Servant
text.p: Question the Dead - Debria will ask the corpse of one who died in the last minute a single question. Depending on the answer she will either never speak of it to anyone, or sell the inforamtion for 50 GP. Debria respects the wishes of the dead. (free to ask)
Ceremony - (Coming Soon) Requiers a sourse of silver.
Identify - I can cast an identify ritual. (Coming Soon) Requiers a sourse of pearls.
A coffin (Coming Soon) Requiers a sourse of lumber.
A tombstone (Coming Soon) Requiers a sourse of stone.
A flask of Raven's Water (Coming Soon) Requiers a sourse of silver.
There are thouse who flee from death. The Night Queen has a price on their bodies. You dont have much to go on, just a name and a price. Bring in the body, get the gold. Debria never asks questions.
There are no bounties at this time.
Located next door to Raven Manor. Run by Kalani.

Fantasy Grounds 5E Race Trait Effects Coding

text.p: The men in here are very frustrated that they cannot get drunk (the magical dome heals them of intoxication immediately).
text.frame: The Merchant's Lair is a gargantuan straw alehouse. As you draw nearer you notice a group of women wearing all black forming a circle around the building.

linklist.link: Artin son of Yilon - Student of Magic
Lance son of Frery - Stable Boy

text.p: Specialty: I love good food and make sure that my tavern always has the best chef available.; Personaltiy: I will never give up. No matter how dark things get.; Ideal: Right - Everyone deserves to live. (Neutral); Bond: I heard a story about some grand place, and deeply want to go there.; Flaw: If I see any who betrayed me, their blood will spill on my hands. Nothing will stop me.

4 with 72 (16d8) hit points; STR: 13 DEX: 13 CON: 13 INT: 13 WIS: 10 CHA: 13; Ranged Weapon Attack: +## to hit. (30/90)5 to hit. On Hit: 5 (1d8) piercing damage and 7 (2d6) radiant damage and 4 (1d6) psychic damage; AC: 14; DC: 14; XP: 1100

Past: Assassin. You are a reformed assassin, and took out targets for monetary gain.; Personality: I like to study how other people act, to see if they might be hiding secrets, like I am.; Ideal: Vengeance - I didn't do anything bad, beforehand. But, now that I have been forced to be how I am, I will. (Evil); Bond: A vigilante believes I am a criminal mastermind, and is hunting me down.; Flaw: I am always angry because of what I have done or what has been done to me.
I am Enerdhil; daughter of Edrahil. I am a middle aged adult (288 years old). I am 3'8" and weigh 145 pounds.;

4 with 72 (16d8) hit points; STR: 10 DEX: 15 CON: 13 INT: 13 WIS: 11 CHA: 11; Ranged Weapon Attack: +## to hit. (100/300)5 to hit. On Hit: 5 (1d8) bludgeoning damage and 7 (2d6) poison damage and 4 (1d6) thunder damage; AC: 14; DC: 14; XP: 1100

Employment: You worked in a Tavern, where you met many travellers, and probably picked up another language and preformed many songs.; Personality: A jolly smile and cheerful laugh is the best way to start the day.; Ideal: Work Ethic - Hard days work for a hard days pay. (Neutral); Bond: My family has run this tavern for years.; Flaw: My bar was raided, which has led to a natural distrust of authority figures.
I am Mildburh; daughter of Eadwulf. I am an ancient adult (327 years old). I am 4'10" and weigh 290 pounds.;

4 with 72 (16d8) hit points; STR: 14 DEX: 14 CON: 14 INT: 15 WIS: 13 CHA: 14; Ranged Weapon Attack: +## to hit. (30/90)5 to hit. On Hit: 5 (1d8) slashing damage and 7 (2d6) poison damage and 7 (1d12) poison damage; AC: 14; DC: 14; XP: 1100
Start: You were rescued by a group of adventurers who then raised you.; Party Role:

; ; Personality: I leave marks for myself wherever I go, as messages to myself when I return. Their meaning is known only by me.; Ideal: Wealth - I'm in it for the money! (Neutral); Bond: The people who raised me made me into an adventurer.; Flaw: I egregiously underestimate or overestimate the risks a job represents.
I am 60989769875 (Male) an Aloii made of a silverish metal. I am a mature adult (476 years old). I am 5' 6" and weigh 350 pounds.; ;

4 with 72 (16d8) hit points; STR: 14 DEX: 12 CON: 9 INT: 15 WIS: 15 CHA: 15; Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit. On Hit: 5 (1d8) slashing damage and 7 (2d6) acid damage and 4 (1d6) force damage; AC: 14; DC: 14; XP: 1100
From the 5th plane, well trained in planar travel, but that seems to be blocked in this plane.

Friends: You are friends with no one important.; Personality: Beggar - Personaltiy; Ideal: Mirth - if you don't laugh, you will cry. So you laugh at everything. (Any); Bond: My families signit ring means everything to me... I will get it back no matter what.; Flaw: As a defense mechanism, I lie and misdirect everyone around me, and steal and hide anything I can.

I am Apolline; son of Marcel. I have lustrous bronze blond, flawless skin and piercing eyes. I am a full ageless adult (10d100 years old). I am 5'6" and weigh 115 pounds.; Personality: I sing dance and generally tend to be happy. This is an experience and I should enjoy every moment of it.; Bond: I need to find an artifact and working with an unsavory group might be my only way to do so.; Ideal: The Greater Good I fight because it is right and I save mortals because they need me (Good); Flaw: My orderly past has a grip on me and I have a hard time standing up to authority figures even when i know they are wrong.;

4 with 72 (16d8) hit points; STR: 10 DEX: 15 CON: 15 INT: 13 WIS: 13 CHA: 12; Ranged Weapon Attack: +## to hit. (40/120)5 to hit. On Hit: 5 (1d8) slashing damage and 7 (2d6) psychic damage and 5 (1d8) acid damage; AC: 14; DC: 14; XP: 1100

id-00024.name: Lance son of Frery - Stable Boy

text.p: Specialty: fighting horse thieves; Personality: I keep all of my possessions meticulously clean, and I hate any kind of filth.; Ideal: Peace - My job is to stop bloodshed. (Good); Bond: I lost my family when I was little. Someone came along and took care of me. There is no way I can ever repay them, but I will do anything in my power to try.; Flaw: I find any reason to fight, often attacking enemies when other solutions could have been met.

I am Lance; son of Frery. I have lustrous peal-white, flawless skin and piercing eyes. I am a full ageless adult (10d100 years old). I am 5'8" and weigh 123 pounds.; Personality: I am intrigued by mortals and am always looking for opportunities to learn about them.; Bond: I could not have continued my mission if not for a brave soldier who saved me from peril at the cost of his own life. I owe his family everything I have.; Ideal: Frivolity I was sent to accomplish something and I will accomplish it when I want to (Chaotic); Flaw: I have tasted of the more vulgar pleasures of the material plane and now i can't seem to resist them.;
recite Emik son of Gutheng's great sonnet

4 with 72 (16d8) hit points; STR: 10 DEX: 10 CON: 14 INT: 11 WIS: 16 CHA: 13; Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit. On Hit: 5 (1d8) piercing damage and 7 (2d6) poison damage and 4 (1d6) acid damage; AC: 14; DC: 14; XP: 1100

id-00025.name: Artin son of Yilon - Student of Magic

text.p: Personality: I tend to talk about magic as if everyone understands it, and cannot comprehend the ignorance of those who do not.; Ideal: Spirit - I will make my Master proud. (Any); Bond: I had a romantic relationship with a fellow student, I still love them.; Flaw: I look down on anyone who was not properly trained in the Magic they wield.
I am Artin son of Yilon; of clan Loderr. I am a mature adult (212 years old). I am 4' and weigh 140 pounds.;

4 with 72 (16d8) hit points; STR: 15 DEX: 14 CON: 10 INT: 15 WIS: 12 CHA: 12; Ranged Weapon Attack: +## to hit. (20/60)5 to hit. On Hit: 5 (1d8) slashing damage and 7 (2d6) force damage and 5 (1d8) radiant damage; AC: 14; DC: 14; XP: 1100
The Merchant's Lair is a gargantuan straw alehouse.

text.frame: As you hack through the underbrush you notice a line of trees so close that its impossible to go between them. As you draw even closer you notice a small opening that looks like it might have been a owlbear trail winding back into the trees.;

; The entire area feels warmer than you would expect.; You notice some scat. The odd thing is that it seems to be made of stones...; There are large piles of predetor bones in various states of decay.; A smooth narrow tunnel melted through stone coming from deep below.
Forshadowing - Zalia

text.p: Fell through the portal while Varric was investigating it.

Personality: I talk very quickly, and always cut to the chase.; Ideal: Greater Good - No matter the circumstances, I am expected to protect those who cannot protect themselves. (Good); Bond: I want to find that special someone and raise a home full of children.; Flaw: Some people want to kill me, to make sure I never tell a secret they'd rather have untold.

I am Mathilde; daughter of Bruce. I have lustrous ginger, flawless skin and piercing eyes. I am a full ageless adult (10d100 years old). I am 5'4" and weigh 120 pounds.; Personality: I tend to over dramatize things and usually tell stories a bit more exciting than they actually are.; Bond: I have grown close to a church of my patron and we trade information often.; Ideal: Service I am here for a purpose and I shall not rest until it is completed (Lawful); Flaw: I am here to save these mortals and i am not afraid to remind them that i am above them;
recite Thathi daughter of Momfik's great novel

4 with 72 (16d8) hit points; STR: 9 DEX: 14 CON: 12 INT: 15 WIS: 9 CHA: 11; Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit. On Hit: 5 (1d8) piercing damage and 7 (2d6) fire damage and 5 (1d8) poison damage; AC: 14; DC: 14; XP: 1100

text.frame: You notice a large tree that stand out from its surroundings. As you draw closer you begin to see that its roots have been pulled apart in one area leaving a winding hole burrowing deep into the ground. Where this cave goes, who knows?;
; A silver bowl with 6 CP.; A silver basin filed with water.; An anvil melded into the floor and shrouded with an inch of ice.; A statue of a fair maiden with arms wide open as if welcoming someone.

linklist.link: Kight of the Order of Vinoa

text.frame: Forshadowing - Knight of the Order of Vinoa

text.p: You walk into a large chamber that is 38 ft. by 24 ft. with a high arching ceiling 7 ft. high. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of jagged sandstone. The air is swirling in tight columns tingling your nose with a damp smell. As you listen carefully you hear creaking from above you.
Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a pressureplate causing fire ball which has the following characteristics:

text.frame: The hallway is 23 ft. wide and 7 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 36 ft. before reaching a corner turning right. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of jagged limestone. The air is slowly drifting past you tingling your nose with a damp smell. As you listen carefully you hear breathing from behind you.

The hallway is 18 ft. wide and 6 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 20 ft. before reaching a branch leaving to the right. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of pitted sandstone. The air is slowly rising tingling your nose with a damp smell. As you listen carefully you hear footsteps from above you.

text.p: You walk into a large chamber that is 14 ft. by 27 ft. with a high arching ceiling 9 ft. high. The area is filled with glowing moss giving off dim light. The walls are made of spikey limestone. The air is slowly rising tingling your nose with a crisp and clean smell. As you listen carefully you hear creaking from behind you.
Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a tripwire causing doors lock and room starts to flood which has the following characteristics:

You walk into a large chamber that is 31 ft. by 24 ft. with a high arching ceiling 13 ft. high. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of bumpy obsidian. The air is unnaturally still tingling your nose with a stale smell. As you listen carefully you hear breathing from above you.
Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a turning of the doornob causing ice storm which has the following characteristics:

text.frame: The hallway is 4 ft. wide and 4 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 43 ft. before reaching a corner turning right. The area is filled with glowing moss giving off dim light. The walls are made of bumpy obsidian. The air is swirling in tight columns tingling your nose with a crisp and clean smell. As you listen carefully you hear creaking in front of you.

text.p: You walk into a large chamber that is 31 ft. by 24 ft. with a high arching ceiling 12 ft. high. The area is filled with glowing moss giving off dim light. The walls are made of spikey granite. The air is slowly drifting past you tingling your nose with a rank smell. As you listen carefully you hear the crackling of a fire from behind you.
Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a tripwire causing doors lock and room starts to flood which has the following characteristics:
The last door is to an empty closet. A treasure room is hidden here dc 20 check.

You walk into a large chamber that is 15 ft. by 21 ft. with a high arching ceiling 10 ft. high. The area is filled with torches giving off bright light; . The walls are made of pitted sandstone. The air is slowly drifting past you tingling your nose with a crisp and clean smell. As you listen carefully you hear footsteps from above you.
Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a magical glyph causing dispenses sleeping gas which has the following characteristics:
A thousand pound door closes when the door is

text.frame: The hallway is 10 ft. wide and 9 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 21 ft. before reaching branches leaving to the left and right. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of pitted obsidian. The air is unnaturally still tingling your nose with a musty smell. As you listen carefully you hear creaking in front of you.

text.p: 30 ft. Wide, 100 ft. wide, filled with gems, gold silver, etc.

You walk into a large chamber that is 44 ft. by 19 ft. with a high arching ceiling 8 ft. high. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of smooth limestone. The air is slowly falling tingling your nose with a rank smell. As you listen carefully you hear an earie silence.
Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a magical glyph causing poison arrow which has the following characteristics:
Critical fail text "When the heir of Tuli arrives the mina can be turned and the passage of Ifa will open."

You walk into a large chamber that is 34 ft. by 34 ft. with a high arching ceiling 15 ft. high. The area is filled with glowing moss giving off dim light. The walls are made of jagged limestone. The air is slowly rising tingling your nose with a musty smell. As you listen carefully you hear meniachal laughter from above you.
Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a turning of the doornob causing ice storm which has the following characteristics:

text.frame: After journeying 15 miles along a strait-cut cobblestone road through rolling hills you begin to hear the sound of the roar of merchants screaming their wares filtering throughout the valley. As you finally come over the last hill you can finally see the city with its high pinacles sticking above the city walls.
text.p: a museum of destoyed towns. many of the exhibits are ashes of various towns.
Government: Anarchism; A complete breakdown of government which tends to result in the rule of the strongest.

list.li: The Dragon's Tree is a large brick taphouse. As you draw nearer you notice a man performing in the street. A master swordsman is playing with a bunch of boys with some wooden swords.; ;
A tiny falling apart pine shack.;
A huge straw stable of horses.;
A large run down straw shack.;
The Merchant's Closet is a large glass bar. As you draw nearer a pig comes flying around the corner of the building with a man waving a knife following not far behind.
A tiny run down ash mansion.;
A tiny falling apart obsidian home.;
A medium ash stable of horses.;

text.p: A playing card set for 7 SP.
Some crossbow bolts for 6 CP a piece.

You are currently Infiltrating the guild.; Your current target is to Kill a reble leader.; Personality: I'm a bit of a show-off.; Ideal: Aspiration - I work hard to be the best there is at my craft. (Any); Bond: I'm trying to pay off an old debt I owe to My Teacher.; Flaw: I love to own other peoples gold- usually taken from their unsuspecting pocket or grave.
I am Luthien; daughter of Eol. I am 3'4" and weigh 110 pounds.;

4 with 72 (16d8) hit points; STR: 11 DEX: 15 CON: 12 INT: 15 WIS: 14 CHA: 12; Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit. On Hit: 5 (1d8) silver damage and 7 (2d6) acid damage and 7 (1d12) poison damage; AC: 14; DC: 14; XP: 1100

list.li: You are descended from Copper Dragons

text.frame: The hallway is 21 ft. wide and 5 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 32 ft. before reaching a corner turning right. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of smooth slate. The air is slowly falling tingling your nose with a earthy smell. As you listen carefully you hear the crackling of a fire in front of you.

text.p: You walk into a large chamber that is 39 ft. by 21 ft. with a high arching ceiling 10 ft. high. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of compacted dirt. The air is still tingling your nose with a stale smell. As you listen carefully you hear cruel laughter in front of you.
Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a turning of the doornob causing poison arrow which has the following characteristics:

You walk into a large chamber that is 33 ft. by 21 ft. with a high arching ceiling 13 ft. high. The area is filled with torches giving off bright light; . The walls are made of compacted dirt. The air is slowly drifting past you tingling your nose with a earthy smell. As you listen carefully you hear moaning from above you.
Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a turning of the doornob causing doors lock and room starts to flood which has the following characteristics:

text.frame: The hallway is 13 ft. wide and 12 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 31 ft. before reaching a corner turning left. The area is filled with glowing moss giving off dim light. The walls are made of smooth obsidian. The air is slowly rising tingling your nose with a stale smell. As you listen carefully you hear meniachal laughter in front of you.

The hallway is 13 ft. wide and 4 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 47 ft. before reaching a corner turning right. The area is filled with natural darkness; . The walls are made of compacted dirt. The air is slowly falling tingling your nose with a musty smell. As you listen carefully you hear cruel laughter from behind you.

The hallway is 9 ft. wide and 13 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 39 ft. before reaching a corner turning right. The area is filled with glowing moss giving off dim light. The walls are made of jagged sandstone. The air is slowly falling tingling your nose with a musty smell. As you listen carefully you hear the crackling of a fire from beneath the floor.

The hallway is 13 ft. wide and 4 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 37 ft. before reaching a crossing path with no path going forward. The area is filled with glowing moss giving off dim light. The walls are made of bumpy slate. The air is slowly rising tingling your nose with a damp smell. As you listen carefully you hear moaning from behind you.

The hallway is 16 ft. wide and 9 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 31 ft. before reaching a corner turning left. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of compacted dirt. The air is slowly falling tingling your nose with a stale smell. As you listen carefully you hear the crackling of a fire in front of you.

text.p: You walk into a large chamber that is 100 ft. by 79 ft. with a high arching ceiling 28 ft. high. The area is filled with natural darkness; . The walls are made of compacted dirt. The air is swirling in tight columns tingling your nose with a earthy smell. As you listen carefully you hear creaking in front of you.
Has a statue of the fair maiden.

You walk into a chamber 20 ft. by 19 ft. The ceiling is 11 ft. high. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of spikey limestone. The room is filled with chests and vases and piles of coins. The air is unnaturally still tingling your nose with a damp smell. As you listen carefully you hear moaning from above you.
Usually the Treasure Chamber is a dead end... but if you wish you may roll.

You walk into a large chamber that is 102 ft. by 108 ft. with a high arching ceiling 32 ft. high. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of compacted dirt. The air is still tingling your nose with a crisp and clean smell. As you listen carefully you hear meniachal laughter from behind you.

text.frame: The hallway is 20 ft. wide and 10 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 29 ft. before reaching a branch leaving to the left. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of smooth sandstone. The air is slowly falling tingling your nose with a stale smell. As you listen carefully you hear an earie silence.

The hallway is 10 ft. wide and 7 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 36 ft. before reaching a corner turning right. The area is filled with candle stands giving off dim light; . The walls are made of spikey limestone. The air is swirling in tight columns tingling your nose with a damp smell. As you listen carefully you hear creaking from beneath the floor.

text.p: You walk into a large chamber that is 102 ft. by 93 ft. with a high arching ceiling 26 ft. high. The area is filled with glowing moss giving off dim light. The walls are made of pitted brick. The air is still tingling your nose with a damp smell. As you listen carefully you hear the crackling of a fire in front of you.

text.frame: The hallway is 13 ft. wide and 9 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 37 ft. before reaching branches leaving to the left and right. The area is filled with natural darkness; . The walls are made of compacted dirt. The air is slowly drifting past you tingling your nose with a rank smell. As you listen carefully you hear breathing from behind you.

text.p: You walk into a large chamber that is 32 ft. by 26 ft. with a high arching ceiling 8 ft. high. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of compacted dirt. The air is slowly rising tingling your nose with a earthy smell. As you listen carefully you hear an earie silence.
Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a turning of the doornob causing fire ball which has the following characteristics:

You walk into a large chamber that is 43 ft. by 42 ft. with a high arching ceiling 15 ft. high. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of jagged sandstone. The air is slowly rising tingling your nose with a damp smell. As you listen carefully you hear the crackling of a fire from behind you.
Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a magical glyph causing a pit in the floor opens over a spiked pit which has the following characteristics:

text.frame: The hallway is 10 ft. wide and 9 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 30 ft. before reaching a crossing path with no path going forward. The area is filled with torches giving off bright light; . The walls are made of smooth limestone. The air is slowly drifting past you tingling your nose with a damp smell. As you listen carefully you hear an earie silence.

text.p: You walk into a large chamber that is 28 ft. by 24 ft. with a high arching ceiling 14 ft. high. The area is filled with torches giving off bright light; . The walls are made of compacted dirt. The air is slowly rising tingling your nose with a earthy smell. As you listen carefully you hear cruel laughter from behind you.
Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a pressureplate causing doors lock and room starts to flood which has the following characteristics:

text.frame: The hallway is 10 ft. wide and 12 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 26 ft. before reaching a branch leaving to the left. The area is filled with natural darkness; . The walls are made of jagged slate. The air is slowly drifting past you tingling your nose with a crisp and clean smell. As you listen carefully you hear the crackling of a fire from behind you.
You notice a dip in the ground and as you come to the edge you see that there is a short cliff with a cave entrance at the bottom of it.;

; The entire area feels warmer than you would expect.; You notice some scat. The odd thing is that it seems to be made of stones...; There are large piles of predetor bones in various states of decay.; A smooth narrow tunnel melted through stone coming from deep below.
Forshadowing - Zalia

The hallway is 19 ft. wide and 10 ft. tall. It goes forward forward 13 ft. before reaching branches leaving to the left and right. The area is filled with glowing moss giving off dim light. The walls are made of polished slate. The air is slowly falling tingling your nose with a damp smell. As you listen carefully you hear the crackling of a fire in front of you.

You walk into a chamber that is 34 ft. by 35 ft. with a ceiling 6 ft. high. The area is filled with glow worms giving off dim light. The walls are made of bumpy limestone. The air is slowly falling tingling your nose with a damp smell. As you listen carefully you hear meniachal laughter in front of you.
text.p: Trap: The trap in this room is triggered by a tripwire causing doors lock and room starts to flood which has the following characteristics:

export.author: Fantasy Grounds College
export.name: West Marches Campaign World
export.thumbnail: C:\\users\\Wineskin\\Application Data\\Fantasy Grounds\\campaigns\\West Marches%3A Thomas\\images\\WMC FGC Smaller Logo.jpg

token.name: Knight of the Order of Vinoa

id-00001.desc:
DC 13 Wisdom saving throw
1d8 necrotic damage
1d12 necrotic damage if target is missing any HP
You point at one creature you can see within range, and the sound of a dolorous bell fills the air around it for a moment. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or take 1d8 necrotic damage. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes 1d12 necrotic damage.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level (2d8 or 2d12), 11th level (3d8 or 3d12), and 17th level (4d8 or 4d12).DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save
id-00001.name: Toll the Dead

id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., throwing, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.\nOff-Hand Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) slashing damage.
id-00002.name: Dagger

id-00003.desc: As an action, you can polymorph into any humanoid of your size that you have seen, or back into your true form. However, your equipment does not change with you. If you die, you revert to your natural appearance.
id-00003.name: Shapechanger

id-00002.name: Dabria
id-00002.skills: Deception +5, Insight +4, Investigation +3, Medicine +4, Religion +3, Carpentry Tools +5, Masonry Tools +5, Perception +5 (w/Raven)

id-00001.desc:
Divination Cantrip
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: Touch
Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute
You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one ability check of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the ability check. The spell then ends.
id-00001.name: Guidance (T) (C)

id-00002.desc:
Conjuration Cantrip
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 30 feet
Duration: 1 minute
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.
You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.
The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.
id-00002.name: Mage Hand (30)

id-00003.desc:
Transmutation Cantrip
Casting Time: 1 minute
Range: Touch
Duration: Instantaneous
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it. leaving no trace of the former damage.
This spell can physically repair a magic item or construct, but the spell can't restore magic to such an object.
id-00003.name: Mending (RIT)

id-00004.desc:
Transmutation Cantrip
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 30 feet
Duration: Instantaneous or 1 hour (see below)
You choose a portion of dirt or stone that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:
If you target an area of loose earth, you can instantaneously excavate it, move it along the ground, and deposit it up to 5 feet away. This movement doesn't have enough force to cause damage.
You cause shapes, colors, or both to appear on the dirt or stone, spelling out words, creating images, or shaping patterns. The changes last for 1 hour.
If the dirt or stone you target is on the ground, you cause it to become difficult terrain. Alternatively, you can cause the ground to become normal terrain if it is already difficult terrain. This change lasts for 1 hour.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.
id-00004.name: Mold Earth (30)

id-00005.desc:
Necromancy Cantrip
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 60 feet
Duration: Instantaneous
You point at one creature you can see within range, and the sound of a dolorous bell fills the air around it for a moment. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d8 necrotic damage. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes 1d12 necrotic damage.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level (2d8 or 2d12), 11th level (3d8 or 3d12), and 17th level (4d8 or 4d12).
id-00005.name: Toll the Dead

id-00006.desc:
Evocation L1
Casting Time: 1 hour
Range: Touch
Duration: Instantaneous (see text)
You perform one of several religious ceremonies. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following ceremonies, the target of which must be within 10 feet of you throughout the casting.
Atonement. 
You touch one willing creature whose alignment has changed, and you make a DC 20 Wisdom (Insight) check. On a success, you restore the target to its original alignment.Bless Water. 
You touch one vial of water and cause it to become holy water.Coming of Age. 
You touch one humanoid old enough to be a young adult. For the next 24 hours, whenever the target makes an ability check, it can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check. A creature can benefit from this ceremony just once.Dedication. 
You touch one humanoid who would willingly convert to your religion or who wishes to be dedicated to your god's service. For the next 24 hours, whenever the target makes a saving throw, it can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the save. A creature can benefit from this ceremony just once.Funeral Rite. 
You bless one corpse within 5 feet of you. For the next 24 hours, the target can't become undead by any means short of a wish spell.Investiture. 
You touch one willing humanoid. Choose one 1st-level spell you have prepared and expend a spell slot and any material components as if you were casting that spell. The spell has no effect. Instead, the target can cast this spell once without having to expend a spell slot or use material components. If the target doesn't cast the spell within 1 hour, the invested spell is lost.Marriage. 
You touch adult humanoids willing to be bonded together in marriage. For the next 24 hours, each target gains a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws while they are within 30 feet of each other. A creature can benefit from this ceremony just once.
id-00006.name: Ceremony

id-00007.desc:
Divination L1
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: Self
Duration: 1 hour
For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any spoken language that you hear. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface on which the words are written. It takes about 1 minute to read one page of text.
This spell doesn't decode secret messages in a text or a glyph, such as an arcane sigil, that isn't part of a written language.
id-00007.name: Comprehend Languages (S)

id-00008.desc:
Divination L1
Casting Time: 1 minute
Range: Touch
Duration: Instantaneous
You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell. If it is a magic item or some other magic-imbued object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn which spell created it.
If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn what spells, if any, are currently affecting it.
id-00008.name: Identify (RIT) (T) ($)

id-00009.desc:
Illusion L2
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 120 feet
Duration: Concentration, up to 10 minutes
For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are deafened while entirely inside it.
Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.
id-00009.name: Silence (120) (C)

id-00010.desc:
Conjuration L1
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 30 feet
Duration: 1 hour
This spell creates a circular, horizontal plane of force, 3 feet in diameter and 1 inch thick, that floats 3 feet above the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The disk remains for the duration, and can hold up to 500 pounds. If more weight is placed on it, the spell ends, and everything on the disk falls to the ground.
The disk is immobile while you are within 20 feet of it. If you move more than 20 feet away from it, the disk follows you so that it remains within 20 feet of you. It can move across uneven terrain, up or down stairs, slopes and the like, but it can't cross an elevation change of 10 feet or more. For example, the disk can't move across a 10-foot-deep pit, nor could it leave such a pit if it was created at the bottom.
If you move more than 100 feet from the disk (typically because it can't move around an obstacle to follow you), the spell ends.
id-00010.name: Tenser's Floating Disk (30)

id-00011.desc:
Conjuration L1
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 60 feet
Duration: 1 hour
This spell creates an invisible, mindless, shapeless force that performs simple tasks at your command until the spell ends. The servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has AC 10, 1 hit point, and a Strength of 2, and it can't attack. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends.
Once on each of your turns as a bonus action, you can mentally command the servant to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. The servant can perform simple tasks that a human servant could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring wine. Once you give the command, the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command.
If you command the servant to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.
id-00011.name: Unseen Servant (60)

id-00012.desc:
Evocation L1
Casting Time: 1 reaction, which you take in response to being damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see
Range: 60 feet
Duration: Instantaneous
You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 2d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
At Higher Levels.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.
id-00012.name: Ravin's Rebuke (R) (60)

id-00013.desc:
Abjuration L1
Casting Time: 1 bonus action
Range: 30 feet
Duration: 1 minute
You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball. If the warded creature makes an attack or casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, this spell ends.
id-00013.name: Sanctuary (B) (30)

id-00014.desc:
Enchantment L2
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 30 feet
Duration: Concentration, up to 8 hours
You suggest a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two) and magically influence a creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you.
Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect. The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable.
Asking the creature to stab itself, throw itself onto a spear, immolate itself, or do some other obviously harmful act ends the spell.
The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability. The suggested course of action can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do. You can also specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration. For example, you might suggest that a knight give her warhorse to the first beggar she meets. If the condition isn't met before the spell expires, the activity isn't performed.
If you or any of your companions damage the target, the spell ends.
id-00014.name: Suggestion (30) (C)

id-00001.desc: You know the mortician life as only someone who has experienced it can. You are able to quickly sumirize the time and method of death for most corpses. You can also do an hour long autopsy to identify the cause of death or the extent of disease. You can find work as a mortician between adventures sufficient to maintain a wealthy lifestyle (see "Practicing a Profession" under "Downtime Activities" in chapter 8 of the Player's Handbook).
id-00001.name: Background: Corpse Study

id-00002.desc:
Starting at 1st level, you gain the service of a spirit sent by the Raven Queen to watch over you. The spirit assumes the form and game statistics of a raven, and it always obeys your commands, which you can give telepathically while it is within 100 feet of you.
While the raven is perched on your shoulder, you gain darkvision with a range of 30 feet and a bonus to your passive Wisdom (Perception) score and to Wisdom (Perception) checks. The bonus equals your Charisma modifier. While perched on your shoulder, the raven can't be targeted by any attack or other harmful effect; only you can cast spells on it; it can't take damage; and it is incapacitated.
You can see through the raven's eyes and hear what it hears while it is within 100 feet of you.
In combat, you roll initiative for the raven and control how it acts. If it is slain by a creature, you gain advantage on all attack rolls against the killer for the next 24 hours.
The raven doesn't require sleep. While it is within 100 feet of you, it can awaken you from sleep as a bonus action.
The raven vanishes when it dies, if you die, or if the two of you are separated by more than 5 miles.
At the end of a short or long rest, you can call the raven back to you--no matter where it is or whether it died--and it reappears within 5 feet of you.
id-00002.name: Raven Queen (1): Sentinel Raven

id-00003.desc: You patron is the Raven Queen, a mysterious being who rules the Shadowfell from a palace of ice deep within that dread realm. The Raven Queen watches over the world, anticipating each creature's death and ensuring that it meets its end at the proscribed time and place. As the ruler of the Shadowfell, she dwells in a decayed, dark reflection of the world. Her ability to reach into the world is limited. Thus, she turns to mortal warlocks to serve her will. Warlocks sworn to the Raven Queen receive visions and whispers from her in their dreams, sending them on quests and warning them of impending dangers.\nThe Raven Queen's followers are expected to serve her will in the world. She concerns herself with ensuring that those fated to die pass from the world as expected, and bids her agents to defeat those who seek to cheat death through undeath or other imitations of immortality. She hates intelligent undead and expects her followers to strike them down, whereas mindless undead such as skeletons and zombies are little more than stumbling automatons in her eyes.
id-00003.name: Raven Queen (1): The Raven Queen

id-00004.desc:
Pact Magic Slots (2)
Cantrips: Guidance, Mage Hand, Mending, Mold Earth, Toll the Dead
Rituals: Ceremony, Comprehend Languages, Identify, Silence, Tenser's Floating Disk, Unseen Servant
Spells: Raven's Rebuke, Sanctuary, Suggestion
id-00004.name: Warlock (1): Pact Magic

id-00005.desc: Pre-requisite: Pact of the Tome feature\nYou can now inscribe magical rituals in your Book of Shadows. Choose two 1st-level spells that have the ritual tag from any class's spell list. The rituals needn't be from the same spell list. The spells appear in the book and don't count against the number of spells you know. With your Book of Shadows in hand, you can cast the chosen spells as rituals. You can't cast the spells except as rituals, unless you've learned them by some other means. You can also cast a warlock spell you know as a ritual if it has the ritual tag. On your adventures, you can add other ritual spells to your Book of Shadows. When you find such a spell, you can add it to the book if the spell's level is equal to or less than half your warlock level (rounded up) and if you can spare the time to transcribe the spell. For each level of the spell, the transcription process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp for the rare inks needed to inscribe it.
id-00005.name: Warlock (2): Eldritch Invocations: Book of Ancient Secrets

id-00006.desc: You can place a corpse's hand or similar appendage on your Book of Shadows and ask one question aloud. After 1 minute, the answer appears written in blood in your book. The answer is provided by the dead creature's spirit to the best of its knowledge and is translated into a language of your choice. You must use this ability within 1 minute of a creature's death, and a given creature can only be asked one question in this manner.
id-00006.name: Warlock (2): Eldritch Invocations: Chronicle of the Raven Queen

id-00007.desc: Book of Death Description\nMy Book of Death has has spells the Raven Queen deems might be a fine, gilt-edged tome with spells of enchantment and illusion, gifted to you by the lordly Archfey. It could be a weighty tome bound in demon hide studded with iron, holding spells of conjuration and a wealth of forbidden lore about the sinister regions of the cosmos, a gift of the Fiend. Or it could be the tattered diary of a lunatic driven mad by contact with the Great Old One, holding scraps of spells that only your own burgeoning insanity allows you to understand and cast.
id-00007.name: Warlock (3): Pact of the Tome

id-00022.carriedby: Ugh AxFace [2], Varric Adahlin [45], Umma Kynes [21], Debria [16], Yelvan [2], Mathris Harrick [31]
id-00022.name: CP

id-00023.carriedby: Ugh AxFace [2], Varric Adahlin [58], Umma Kynes [14], Debria [34], Yelvan [2], Mathris Harrick [45]
id-00023.name: SP

id-00024.carriedby: Ugh AxFace [3], Varric Adahlin [57], Umma Kynes [20], Debria [27], Yelvan [8], Mathris Harrick [43]
id-00024.name: GP

description.p: This spell scroll bears the words of a single spell, Moonbeam , written in a mystical cipher. If the spell is on your class's spell list, you can read the scroll and cast its spell without providing any material components. Otherwise, the scroll is unintelligible. Casting the spell by reading the scroll requires the spell's normal casting time. Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and it crumbles to dust. If the casting is interrupted, the scroll is not lost.

If the spell is on your class's spell list but of a higher level than you can normally cast, you must make an ability check using your spellcasting ability to determine whether you cast it successfully. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a failed check, the spell disappears from the scroll with no other effect.
Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and the scroll itself crumbles to dust.
This spell scroll's saving throw DC 13 and attack bonus +5.

A wizard spell on a spell scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When a spell is copied from a spell scroll , the copier must succeed on an Intelligence (Arcana) check with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

id-00001.name: Scroll of Moonbeam
id-00001.nonidentified: The materials used in this scroll are of very high quality and the writing is precise and done with a great deal of care and attention to detail.
